content.description: start in an awkward finger crack that quickly works into  A solid hand/fist crack. three quarters of the way up there is a little ledge where the crack splits to two. the left crack is flared and getting up into the upper right crack is the Crux but beautiful fists the rest of the way up.  once at the top of the crack you're on a ledge but squat due to a large boulder. from the last ledge climbing up and right to the top. there is one bolt and hanger placed. and a nice crack that eats gear for building an anchor.
content.protection: Nuts for the bottom  with larger cams up top  #3/#4 was easiest.  The crack next to the anchor hanger takes a BD .75 nicely
content.location: the obvious hand/fist crack that splits to two cracks at the top. just to the left of Dirty Flamingo

content.description: a beautiful test piece finger crack with a crux Where it really starts to wonders left but quickly mellows out once you get moving vertical again. follow the crack system up the face to just right of the Albino Peacock
content.location: directly to the right of Albino Peacock.

content.description:
This is the dirty corner right above the strange little cave. Keeping left in the crack/corner will keep it more interesting, while stemming and using the face holds and opposing walls on the right will keep it more towards a 5.8.

The crux is probably down low, and the only protection on the lower part of the climb is a couple of pockets for cams, and the first one is fairly high up after a pretty interesting start, hence the PG-13 rating.

I thought it was a fun and interesting climb. We did some cleaning, but more is in order, and I think it will clean up nice.

Pretty good opportunities to build a gear anchor at the top if you'd like to top rope it first. you can go up and around either left or right with a bit of scrambling to get to the top. We'd like to put some anchor bolts at the top of these. They are fun climbs with a nice little belay area at the bottom.
content.location: Deep into the corner right above the small cave.

content.description: starts with a hand crack in the corner with a few face features to the right and eventually works its way into an off width/squeeze chimney to the top. Â  the crux was pulling from the fists into the off width.
content.protection: Gobbles Nuts for the first half placed a #4 at the start of the off width a #5or#6 could be used in the squeeze chimney but I lacked it
content.location: the obvious staight crack in the left corner that flares at the top.
